titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society Committee on Divisional Activities records 1909-1982
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society Committee on Divisional Activities records

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The Council Committee on Divisional Activities has responsibility for oversight and coordination of activities of the 33 divisions of the Society.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records from the ACS Council Committee on Divisional Activities (formerly referred to as the Office of Divisional Activities). Materials include correspondence and other documents, such as brochures, by-laws, and membership directories, sent from the divisions to the Committee on Divisional Activities. The collection also includes a short general history of the divisions of the ACS.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
